15th April 2024 at 10:15 am at Fraunhofer Heinrich-Hertz-Institut, Lanolinfabrik, Salzufer 15-16, 5th floor, room LF.05-28

View Synthesis (image-based rendering) and 3D reconstruction of persons,
    objects and scenes is applied in many areas such as media production,
    video communication, as well as in the industrial and medical sector.
    New visualization techniques, like Virtual and Augmented Reality offer
    completely new application scenarios. After an introduction on camera
    model and stereo geometry, this lecture is concerned with extended
    analysis of the geometry of multiple views. A detailed overview on novel
    view synthesis and 3D reconstruction is given, with a strong link to
    recent results achieved in current research projects at Fraunhofer
    Heinrich Hertz Institute.
The lecture is given in English. The exam will be performed as written exam at the end of the semester.
Hardenbergstraße 36, Charlottenburg), start of the exam at 11:00.
